Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided text, there isn't any specific mention of sustainable or environmental practices being implemented directly by Scratch Supply Co. However, they do emphasize the importance of longevity and visible mending, which could contribute to reducing waste and promoting a circular economy. Additionally, the use of wool in some of their classes suggests a focus on natural materials, which has potential eco-friendly benefits if sourced responsibly.

source.content: At Scratch Supply Co we believe in sustainability through longevity When you first made that item you hoped it would last forever - or the person who made it for you imagined you wearing or using it far into the future But life happens Sometimes the most life happens to the most well-loved items We think of those events as opportunities for visible mending that will become part of your garment’s story Have an item that needs repair Click below to fill out our mending services inquiry form and tell us a little about your project There’s information on how to send us images after you submit the form We’ll take a look at your project assess what it needs and figure out how we can help If you have images of the item you would like to have mended you can submit them here You can also send them via email to  Please include “mending” in the subject line of your email That depends on the project Most mending can be completed within a few hours but sometimes it takes us a bit of time to

This class series is designed for children ages 5 and up to take with their adult Each registration is for one adult and one child This class is filled with crafts made with wool We will make 'tigers' eyes' a pine cone sheep and a painting from wool roving Adults must stay with children at all times Join us for this fun and very hands on class All supplies included This class series is designed for children ages 5 and up to take with their adult Each registration is for one adult and one child This class is filled with crafts made with wool We will make 'tigers' eyes' a pine cone sheep and a painting from wool roving Adults must stay with children at all times Join us for this fun and very hands on class All supplies included

At Scratch Supply Co we believe in sustainability through longevity When you first made that item you hoped it would last forever - or the person who made it for you imagined you wearing or using it far into the future But life happens Sometimes the most life happens to the most well-loved items We think of those events as opportunities for visible mending that will become part of your garment’s story Have an item that needs repair Click below to fill out our mending services inquiry form and tell us a little about your project There’s information on how to send us images after you submit the form We’ll take a look at your project assess what it needs and figure out how we can help If you have images of the item you would like to have mended you can submit them here You can also send them via email to  Please include “mending” in the subject line of your email That depends on the project Most mending can be completed within a few hours but sometimes it takes us a bit of time to

them via email to  Please include “mending” in the subject line of your email That depends on the project Most mending can be completed within a few hours but sometimes it takes us a bit of time to strategize how best to approach damaged areas Items are repaired on a first-received first-serviced basis We will try to give you an idea of expected turnaround time when we respond to your inquiry In the case of moth damage or suspected moth damage we will need to store your item in the freezer for at least three weeks to kill any potential eggs/larvae before bringing the garment into the shop Sometimes we get very lucky with an item that is documented  wool in which case we can use an alternative method of baking the item in an oven but if we suspect there’s even a little acrylic content in the fiber we will go the safe route and store it in the freezer - unfortunately the temperature needed to eliminate moths also melts acrylic Due to the nature of mending it is impossible to give a

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
Based on the provided context, there are several products, services, and technologies mentioned or implied. Some of these include:

1. Spinning classes and workshops for various skill levels (novices to advanced) using drop spindles and wheel spinning techniques.
2. Fiber materials such as wool, alpaca, silk, etc., used for spinning and creating handmade textiles.
3. Private lessons for focused attention on specific techniques or patterns.
4. Mending services for repairing and restoring worn or damaged clothing and textile items.
5. Online shopping platform for browsing and purchasing classes, event registrations, and related supplies.
6. In-store availability of all products and services, even though some aspects may be temporarily unavailable online during the transition period.
7. Sustainable practices and emphasis on longevity in craftsmanship.

We’re in the process of overhauling our online shopping experience To avoid any issues during the transition only classes and event registration will be available online Everything is available in-store and will be back online soon Whether you’re a novice or advanced a drop spindle or wheel spinner come join us as we build our skills and explore different types of fiber together

At Scratch Supply Co we believe in sustainability through longevity When you first made that item you hoped it would last forever - or the person who made it for you imagined you wearing or using it far into the future But life happens Sometimes the most life happens to the most well-loved items We think of those events as opportunities for visible mending that will become part of your garment’s story Have an item that needs repair Click below to fill out our mending services inquiry form and tell us a little about your project There’s information on how to send us images after you submit the form We’ll take a look at your project assess what it needs and figure out how we can help If you have images of the item you would like to have mended you can submit them here You can also send them via email to  Please include “mending” in the subject line of your email That depends on the project Most mending can be completed within a few hours but sometimes it takes us a bit of time to

Want dedicated time for assistance with a technique or pattern that you're working on Book a private lesson Drop-in help is also available but booking a time guarantees focused attention from a staff member who is not performing other shop duties

At Scratch Supply Co we believe in sustainability through longevity When you first made that item you hoped it would last forever - or the person who made it for you imagined you wearing or using it far into the future But life happens Sometimes the most life happens to the most well-loved items We think of those events as opportunities for visible mending that will become part of your garment’s story Have an item that needs repair Click below to fill out our mending services inquiry form and tell us a little about your project There’s information on how to send us images after you submit the form We’ll take a look at your project assess what it needs and figure out how we can help If you have images of the item you would like to have mended you can submit them here You can also send them via email to  Please include “mending” in the subject line of your email That depends on the project Most mending can be completed within a few hours but sometimes it takes us a bit of time to

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objective and outcome expected from these collaborations involve learning about and engaging in various aspects of spinning and textile arts. These include understanding how to ply, discuss techniques and patterns, learn about different types of wheels, and gain experience using a wheel to create handspun yarns. Additionally, students will have opportunities to troubleshoot issues, cover common mistakes, and explore different methods for setting yarn for specific uses. Throughout this process, participants will develop skills and knowledge related to spinning, plying, and using handspun yarns in their final projects. By bringing multiple small balls of yarn to class, students will have access to a variety of fibers and textures, further enhancing their understanding and appreciation of handspun yarns. Overall, the primary goal of these collaborative efforts is to provide a comprehensive educational experience that fosters creativity, skill development, and a deeper connection to the craft of spinning and textile artistry.

source.content: You've spun your first single strand of yarn Now What This class will teach you how to ply discuss covering mistakes while you ply as well has how many plys should be in your yarn and how to set your yarn for using in final projects Students should bring at least two small balls of yarn to class They may bring as much as they would like You've spun your first single strand of yarn Now What This class will teach you how to ply discuss covering mistakes while you ply as well has how many plys should be in your yarn and how to set your yarn for using in final projects Students should bring at least two small balls of yarn to class They may bring as much as they would like

Using yarn that you have made is a very satisfying feeling This class will teach you how to use a wheel discuss different types of wheels and get you started on your spinning journey Students should bring a working wheel or contact us to use one of ours Class fee includes a 5 materials fee for spinning fiber Students may bring their own fiber for use after they are comfortable spinning and for discussion This should be clean washed fiber or fleeces wrapped up well as to not make a big mess Using yarn that you have made is a very satisfying feeling This class will teach you how to use a wheel discuss different types of wheels and get you started on your spinning journey Students should bring a working wheel or contact us to use one of ours Class fee includes a 5 materials fee for spinning fiber Students may bring their own fiber for use after they are comfortable spinning and for discussion This should be clean washed fiber or fleeces wrapped up well as to not make a big mess
